alert.note: Alert for Culpeper; Fauquier (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 6:24AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following counties: Culpeper and Fauquier. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 AM EDT, Emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Culpeper... Warrenton... Bealeton... New Baltimore... Opal... Midland... Jeffersonton... Rixeyville... Alanthus... Turnbull... Catalpa... Cardova... Casanova... Boston... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
